Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Y12M (N-terminal GSKKPVPII deleted, thanatin analog, synthetic AMPs, 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, insects, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (57.14%) toThanatinR: 25%, C: 17%.Chemical modification: C-C disulfide bond .Activity: active against Gram+ A. viridans (MIC 20-40 uM), M. luteus (MIC  20-40 uM), B. megaterium (MIC  20-40 uM), B-subtilis (MIC >40 uM), S-aureus (MIC > 40 uM), P-acidolactici (MIC >40 uM), Gram- E-coli D22 or D31 or 106 (MIC >40 uM) , S-typhimurium (MIC >40 uM), K-pneumoniae (MIC>40 uM), E-cloacae (MIC >40 uM), E-carotovora (MIC >40 uM), P-aeruginosa (MIC >40 uM), fungi N-crassa (MIC >40 uM), B-cinerea (MIC >40 uM), N-haematococca (MIC >40 uM), T-viride (MIC >40 uM), A-brassicola (MIC >40 uM), F-culmorum (MIC>40 uM), A-pisi (MIC >40 uM), and F-oxysporum (MIC >40 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Fehlbaum P, Bulet P, Chernysh S, Briand JP, Roussel JP, Letellier L, Hetru C, Hoffmann JA. 1996
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1996 Feb 6;93(3):1221-5. doi: 10.1073/pnas.93.3.1221.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Structure-activity analysis of thanatin, a 21-residue inducible insect defense peptide with sequence homology to frog skin antimicrobial peptides.
